definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: Consider a group of n miners, who have discovered large bars of gold.
sentences.chinese: 考虑找到了大量金条的n个挖矿者。

sentences.english: Gold bars LeiZiFeng from hand to take.
sentences.chinese: 金条是从雷子枫手中夺到的。

sentences.english: Wang went to the waste house to send gold bars, along the way was Yao Bangyan candid camera.
sentences.chinese: 王蝶衣去废屋送金条，一路上被姚邦彦偷拍。

sentences.english: When the gold was heated and melted, they poured it into a mould to form a gold bar.
sentences.chinese: 当金子加热融化后，他们把金水倒进模子，铸成金条。

sentences.english: Precious metal in non-coin form such as ingots, bars or wafers.
sentences.chinese: 非硬币形状的贵金属，例如金块或金条。

sentences.english: The ornamented gold bar commemorating the Year of the Dog is still our most popular item.
sentences.chinese: 作为狗年纪念品的饰物金条仍然是顾客最喜爱的首选。

sentences.english: A single bar here might contain bits of a pharaoh's goblet and a conquistador's ingot.
sentences.chinese: 一根金条可能曾经是法老的高脚杯或征服者的财宝。

sentences.english: A bank official hoists one of the bars over to me.
sentences.chinese: 一位银行官员拿起一根金条递给我。

sentences.english: Paper money, it seemed, had to be convertible into bullion on demand for it to be accepted.
sentences.chinese: 纸币似乎必须能即刻兑换成金条银条才能为人接受。

sentences.english: Police have launched a man-hunt for the bullion robbers.
sentences.chinese: 警方已大举搜捕抢劫金条的罪犯。

sentences.english: He in the name of the security bureau, a sinner, eight gold bar.
sentences.chinese: 他以保安局的名义，讹诈了八根金条。

definition: BRIC/BRICS economic bloc (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa)
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
Yuanbao district of Dandong city 丹東市|丹东市[Dan1 dong1 shi4], Liaoning
a silver or gold ingot/mock ingot (burnt as offering in worship)/a name for ancient currency/a rare genius
